parent_section_titles: Questions
Questions asked to the Minister of Police

speeches.intro: 2005. Ms A M Dreyer (DA) to ask the Minister of Police:
speeches.text: What steps have been taken to address the security threat at the President’s official residence, King’s House, in Durban, specifically with reference to the growth of the bamboo bush outside the property’s security fence which falls inside the property’s perimeter?

title: NW2361E - 08 August 2013

parent_section_titles: Questions
Questions asked to the Minister of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries
questionto: Minister of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

speeches.intro: 1994. Mrs A Steyn (DA) to ask the Minister of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries:
speeches.text: (1) What is the average length of time it takes to process an application for the rezoning of agricultural land; (2) (a) how many applications (i) for rezoning of agricultural land has her department received in each year since 2009 and (ii) have not yet been finalised and (b) what is the reason for the delay in each case?

title: NW2350E - 08 August 2013

parent_section_titles: Questions
Questions asked to the Minister of Basic Education

speeches.intro: 1999. Mrs A T Lovemore (DA) to ask the Minister of Basic Education:
speeches.text: (1) What are the full details of the rationale for her decision to continue the administrative intervention in the Limpopo Department of Education in terms of section 100(1)(b) of the Constitution of the Republic of South Africa, 1996; (2) what change(s) in the current circumstances in Limpopo will result in a decision to recommend the termination of the intervention; (3) what are the full details of the rationale for her decision to change the level of administrative intervention in the Eastern Cape Department of Education from that provided for in section 100(1)(b) of the Constitution of the Republic of South Africa, 1996, to that provided for in section 100(1)(a); (4) by what date does she anticipate that the altered level of intervention will come into effect; (5) what recourse is available to her to enforce compliance with section 100(1)(a) of the Constitution of the Republic of South Africa, 1996?

title: NW2355E - 08 August 2013

parent_section_titles: Questions
Questions asked to the Minister of Basic Education

speeches.intro: 2000. Mrs A T Lovemore (DA) to ask the Minister of Basic Education:
speeches.text: Whether all persons employed to mark National Senior Certificate examination papers in 2013 will be required to undergo a competency test; if not, why not; if so, what are the relevant details of the (a) planned testing and (b) action(s) following the testing?

title: NW2356E - 08 August 2013

parent_section_titles: Questions
Questions asked to the Minister of Basic Education

speeches.intro: 2001. Mrs A T Lovemore (DA) to ask the Minister of Basic Education:
speeches.text: Whether she requested the Public Service Commission (PSC) to investigate the conduct of her department’s Director-General, as required under the heading Decision of the President in the Report of the Presidential Task Team established to investigate the non-delivery and/or delays in the delivery of Learner Teacher Support Material in Limpopo schools in the 2012 school year; if not, why not; if so, what are the relevant details of the PSC investigation, including action taken or action to be taken based on the findings?

title: NW2357E - 08 August 2013

Questions asked to the Minister of Trade and Industry

speeches.intro: 2019. Adv A de W Alberts (FF Plus) to ask the Minister of Trade and Industry:
speeches.text: Whether, in the light of less and less industries buying electricity from Eskom, he has found that, notwithstanding the implementation of the Industrial Policy Action Plan (IPAP), the economy is currently de-industrialising; if so, what steps is he planning to take so as to counter de-industrialisation; if not, what indications are there that industrialisation is working?

title: NW2377E - 08 August 2013

parent_section_titles: Questions
Questions asked to the Minister of Basic Education

speeches.intro: 2011. Mrs C Dudley (ACDP) to ask the Minister of Basic Education:
speeches.text: With reference to her reply to question 2521 on 18 October 2012, (a) whom did her department contact during their extensive consultation process on the development of a policy on homeschooling, (b) who does her department recognise as the elected representatives of the organised homeschooling community and (c) was this organisation contacted during the specified consultation process; if not, why not; if so, what are the relevant details?

title: NW2326E - 08 August 2013

speeches.intro: 2017. Mrs J D Kilian (Cope) to ask the Minister for Cooperative Governance and Traditional Affairs:
speeches.text: (1) Whether he has been informed of the ongoing billing crisis in the City of Johannesburg Metropolitan Municipality; if not, what is the position in this regard; if so, what interventions have been made; (2) whether his department has been informed of the cause for the billing crisis; if not, what is the position in this regard; if so, what are the details; (3) whether (a) a certain household (details furnished) was served with a final notice in the first week of August 2013 and (b) the headquarters of the ANC, Luthuli House, was served with an incorrect bill dated 24 May 2013; if so, how was each matter resolved; (4) whether the said metro has implemented all the necessary measures to restore the integrity of the billing system; if not, what corrective measures will his department implement to assist the metro; if so, what are the relevant details?

title: NW2375E - 08 August 2013

parent_section_titles: Questions
Questions asked to the Minister of Basic Education

speeches.intro: 2018. Mrs J D Kilian (Cope) to ask the Minister of Basic Education:
speeches.text: (1) Whether her department, in terms of the Government's responsibility with regard to no-fee schools, maintains the records of schoolgoing children of (a) citizens as well as (b) noncitizens for planning and budgeting purposes; if not, why not; if so, (2) what (a) was the ratio of children of citizens to children of noncitizens in the (i) 2011-12 and (ii) 2012-13 financial years and (b) is the ratio currently; (3) whether her department can provide a provincial breakdown of the data for the (a) 2010-11, (b) 2011-12 and (c) 2012-13 financial years; if not, why not; (4) (a) what are the estimated costs per learner in (i) primary and (ii) secondary schools for the current financial year and (b) how do the figures compare to the costs per learner in the (i) 2011-12 and (ii) 2012-13 financial years; (5) whether her department has found that the trend of migration to South Africa will jeopardise the Government's ability to improve school infrastructure and the quality of education to the poorest quintile in the primary and secondary school sector; if not, what is the position in this regard; if so, how does she intend to implement corrective steps?

speeches.text: (1) Have any amakhosi benefitted from the sale or leasing of land held by the Ingonyama Trust Board; if so, what are the relevant details; (2) what is the current balance held in each of the Ingonyama Trust Board accounts; (3) (a) what projects have been delivered by the Ingonyama Trust Board in the (i) 2008-09, (ii) 2009-10, (iii) 2010-11, (iv) 20011-12 and (v) 2012-13 financial years and (b) what was the value of each of the projects; (4) what laws and regulations are used to (a) dispose of and (b) lease properties and land held by (i) the Ingonyama Trust and (ii) traditional tribal authorities; (5) how are decisions made on the use of the moneys held by the (a) Ingonyama Trust and (b) traditional authorities?

questionto: Minister of Defence and Military Veterans

speeches.intro: 1972. Mr P J Groenewald (FF Plus) to ask the Minister of Defence and Military Veterans:
speeches.text: (1) With reference to her reply to question 2760 on 13 December 2010, (a) how many of the 250 kg bombs that displayed crystallisation were destroyed, (b)(i) what calibre of ammunition is kept in 93 Ammunition Depot at Jan Kempdorp, where the explosives are probably in a phase of crystallisation, and (ii) how much of this type of ammunition is there in the depot, (c) on what date was this ammunition manufactured and (d) what steps will be taken to protect the lives of those members who will have to destroy this ammunition; (2) whether the licences of any more magazines have been restricted because the informal settlement at Jan Kempdorp has developed to within the original danger zones; if so, (a) how many magazines, (b) by how many kilograms the licence for each separate magazine has been reduced and (c) what is the distance from the nearest informal settlement to the border of the depot; (3) whether all of the depot’s lightning conductors are serviced annually; if not, why not; if so, how many of the conductors of magazines (a) have been fully serviced and (b) have yet to be serviced this year; (4) whether (a) all of the roofs have been repaired and (b) any of the magazine roofs are leaking; if so, in each case, (i) how many and (ii) what steps are being taken to repair the leaks; (5) whether she will make a statement on the matter?

title: NW2307E - 08 August 2013

parent_section_titles: Questions
Questions asked to the Minister of Rural Development and Land Reform
questionto: Minister of Rural Development and Land Reform

speeches.intro: 1973. Mr P J Groenewald (FF Plus) to ask the Minister of Rural Development and Land Reform:
speeches.text: (1) With reference to his reply to question 1540 on 23 July 2013, what amount has the Government paid in compensation for the loss of land in each financial year since the start of its programme in respect of restitution of land to beneficiaries; (2) how many hectares of land will be given back to beneficiaries in each financial year in terms of the programme regarding the restitution of land in instances where financial compensation is not accepted?

title: NW2308E - 08 August 2013

parent_section_titles: Questions
Questions asked to the Minister of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries
questionto: Minister of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries

speeches.intro: 1975. Mr R N Cebekhulu (IFP) to ask the Minister of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries:
speeches.text: (1) What are the effects of genetic engineering on biodiversity through gene flow modified crops; (2) whether any long-term research is being conducted into the effects of genetic engineering on (a)(i) human and (ii) animal health and (b) the environment; (3) whether her department is applying the precautionary principle and adopting policy which promotes organic farming practices; (4) whether her department supports research into methods of reducing the impact of agriculture on the environment; (5) whether she can elaborate on the health problems that are associated with the herbicides (a) glufosinate and (b) glyphosate they want to use?

title: NW2331E - 08 August 2013

parent_section_titles: Questions
Questions asked to the Minister of Rural Development and Land Reform
questionto: Minister of Rural Development and Land Reform

speeches.intro: 1977. Mr R N Cebekhulu (IFP) to ask the Minister of Rural Development and Land Reform:
speeches.text: How much did his department spend on (a) reviving irrigation schemes in all districts and (b) rejuvenating the Ncora Irrigation Scheme in Engcobo?

title: NW2333E - 08 August 2013

parent_section_titles: Questions
Questions asked to the Minister of Defence and Military Veterans
questionto: Minister of Defence and Military Veterans

speeches.intro: 1982. Mr S Esau (DA) to ask the Minister of Defence and Military Veterans:
speeches.text: How will (a) the Department of Military Veterans maintain its infrastructure, including (i) memorial and (ii) heritage sites and (b) this department maintain the specified sites beyond the Medium Term Expenditure Framework (MTEF) period?

title: NW2338E - 08 August 2013

parent_section_titles: Questions
Questions asked to the Minister of Defence and Military Veterans
questionto: Minister of Defence and Military Veterans

speeches.intro: 1983. Mr S Esau (DA) to ask the Minister of Defence and Military Veterans:
speeches.text: What (a) services has the Department of Military Veterans put out to tender by private sector companies for the period 2013-14 and (b) service level agreements exist in this regard?

title: NW2339E - 08 August 2013

parent_section_titles: Questions
Questions asked to the Minister of Defence and Military Veterans
questionto: Minister of Defence and Military Veterans

speeches.intro: 1984. Mr S Esau (DA) to ask the Minister of Defence and Military Veterans:
speeches.text: (a) How did the Department of Military Veterans assist 100 military veterans to obtain certificates approved by the SA Qualifications Authority (SAQA) in the 2012-13 financial year and (b) what plans are in place to reach the target of 1000 in the 2013-14 financial year?

title: NW2340E - 08 August 2013

parent_section_titles: Questions
Questions asked to the Minister of Health

speeches.intro: 1981. Mrs S P Kopane (DA) to ask the Minister of Health:
speeches.text: (1) Whether there was an independent investigation into a certain person (details furnished); if so, (a) on what basis was it instituted and (b) what were the allegations; (2) whether a final report of the investigation was compiled; if so, (a) when and (b) when did he receive the report; (3) what are the (a) findings and (b) recommendations of the report; (4) when will the report be made public; (5) what (a) actions will be taken based on the report and (b) are the reasons for any action or recommendation not to be taken?

title: NW2337E - 08 August 2013
